text: To return an item you've bought on Amazon,
first go to Amazon.com
and click the "Returns & Orders" button.
This will take you to your orders page,

which shows you items
you've purchased recently.

Most items can be returned
within 30 days of purchase.

For some items sold
through an Amazon seller,

you'll need to click the
"Submit return request" button.

Then the Amazon seller
will review your request
before issuing a refund or a replacement.
Go to the order you'd like to return

and click the "Return or
replace items" button.

Next, you'll be asked which
items you'd like to return
from a list of eligible items.

After selecting an item,
you'll see a drop-down

asking you to choose the
reason for the refund.
When you're done, click "Continue."

Next, you'll select
whether you'd like a refund
or a replacement.

Then you'll choose how you'd
like the money refunded.
It can either be sent to
the card you used to purchase the item
or in the form of Amazon credit.

Now choose how you'd
like to return the item.
There are a couple options.

You can return the item
using drop-off locations.

First, select from several
nearby drop-off spots,

like your local Amazon
store, Kohl's, or UPS.

Options will vary depending
on where you live.
Then a QR code will be sent to your email.
To return the item,
bring it to the selected drop-off location

and present your QR code
along with the item.

If you select this option,
you can return your item

without packing it up or
printing a return label.
The refund will begin processing
the moment the QR code is scanned.

You can process the return
without leaving your house

if you select the UPS
pickup return method.

With this option, you'll
select a time frame
for UPS to come and pick up your return.
You'll need to package the item,
and a UPS delivery person
will bring the label for the package.
Once the item is scanned by UPS,
your return will begin processing.
